CHAPTER 1-5
DUTIES  AND  COMPENSATION  OF APPOINTIVE  OFFICIALS
1-5-1 
DUTIES GENERALLY
The Appointed Officials and employees of the City of Brandon shall have the powers and
perform the duties as specified and all other powers and duties as given or required by the
laws of the State of South Dakota, ordinances of the City of Brandon, and such other
powers and duties as the City Council may from time to time order, not inconsistent with
the laws of the State.
Legislative History:
   
Authority:
1990 Revisions.                   
SDCL Ch. 9-14 generally.
Ordinance #571, 1/1/19.
1-5-2
COMPENSATION;  DEFINITION OF
Compensation, under this chapter, means the same as reimbursement or repair or covering
the costs of such specified items which would be included in repair.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.                
SDCL ยง 9-12-2; See Also Ch. 9-14
generally.
1-5-3 
COMPENSATION; GENERAL APPLICATION
The City of Brandon may appropriate funds to pay the necessary expenses of its
Appointed and Elected Officials and employees in conducting such business or attending
such meetings as the governing body shall determine necessary to carry out authorized
municipal activities.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.                
SDCL ยง 9-12-2; See Also Ch. 9-14 generally
Ordinance #571, 1/1/19.
1-5-4 
PERSONNEL POLICIES AND BENEFITS
 
The City Council of the City of Brandon shall have the power and authority to establish
and from time to time amend by resolution, personnel policies for City employees which
shall include but are not limited to, policies regarding job descriptions, salaries and
employee benefits such as sick leave and vacation leave.
Legislative History:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance #571, 1/1/19.
